happy.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
happy.author: Steve Jobs

happy.text: Happiness is not by chance, but by choice.
happy.author: Jim Rohn

happy.text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
happy.author: Walt Whitman

happy.text: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
happy.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

happy.text: The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
happy.author: Mark Twain

happy.text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
happy.author: Mahatma Gandhi

happy.text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
happy.author: Dalai Lama

happy.text: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
happy.author: John Lennon

happy.text: Joy is not in things; it is in us.
happy.author: Richard Wagner

happy.text: The moments of happiness we enjoy take us by surprise. It is not that we seize them, but that they seize us.
happy.author: Ashley Montagu

happy.text: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
happy.author: Mother Teresa

happy.text: Happiness is a direction, not a place.
happy.author: Sydney J. Harris

happy.text: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
happy.author: Omar Khayyam

happy.text: The happiest people don't have the best of everything, they just make the best of everything.
happy.author: Anonymous

happy.text: Enjoy the little things in life, for one day you'll look back and realize they were the big things.
happy.author: Robert Brault

excited.text: Dream big and dare to fail.
excited.author: Norman Vaughan

excited.text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
excited.author: William James

excited.text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
excited.author: Sean Patrick Flanery

excited.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
excited.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

excited.text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
excited.author: Helen Keller

excited.text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
excited.author: Tony Robbins

excited.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
excited.author: Sam Levenson

excited.text: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
excited.author: George Addair

excited.text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
excited.author: Chinese Proverb

excited.text: Great things never come from comfort zones.
excited.author: Anonymous

excited.text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
excited.author: Walt Disney

excited.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
excited.author: Mark Twain

excited.text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
excited.author: Henry David Thoreau

neutral.text: Every moment is a fresh beginning.
neutral.author: T. S. Eliot

neutral.text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
neutral.author: Confucius

neutral.text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
neutral.author: Robert Collier

neutral.text: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
neutral.author: Peter Marshall

neutral.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
neutral.author: Lao Tzu

neutral.text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
neutral.author: Albert Einstein

neutral.text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
neutral.author: Charles R. Swindoll

neutral.text: Today is a new day. You will get out of it just what you put into it.
neutral.author: Mary Pickford

neutral.text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
neutral.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

neutral.text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.
neutral.author: Henry Ford

neutral.text: Every day may not be good, but there's something good in every day.
neutral.author: Alice Morse Earle

neutral.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
neutral.author: Walt Disney

neutral.text: Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!'
neutral.author: Audrey Hepburn

neutral.text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
neutral.author: Norman Vincent Peale

sad.text: Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
sad.author: Nido Qubein

sad.text: It always seems impossible until it's done.
sad.author: Nelson Mandela

sad.text: If you want the rainbow, you have to put up with the rain.
sad.author: Dolly Parton

sad.text: Tough times never last, but tough people do.
sad.author: Robert H. Schuller

sad.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
sad.author: C.S. Lewis

sad.text: It's okay to not be okay as long as you are not giving up.
sad.author: Anonymous

sad.text: Every storm runs out of rain.
sad.author: Maya Angelou

sad.text: The sun himself is weak when he first rises, and gathers strength and courage as the day gets on.
sad.author: Charles Dickens

sad.text: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
sad.author: Helen Keller

sad.text: Hope is the only thing stronger than fear.
sad.author: Suzanne Collins

sad.text: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
sad.author: Henry Ford

sad.text: The darkest hour has only sixty minutes.
sad.author: Morris Mandel

sad.text: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated.
sad.author: Maya Angelou

angry.text: Holding onto anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
angry.author: Buddha

angry.text: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
angry.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

angry.text: The best fighter is never angry.
angry.author: Lao Tzu

angry.text: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
angry.author: Mark Twain

angry.text: When angry, count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
angry.author: Thomas Jefferson

angry.text: Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.
angry.author: Ambrose Bierce

angry.text: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
angry.author: Seneca

angry.text: In a controversy, the instant we feel anger, we have already ceased striving for truth and have begun striving for ourselves.
angry.author: Abraham J. Heschel

angry.text: Anybody can become angry — that is easy, but to be angry with the right person and to the right degree and at the right time and for the right purpose, and in the right way — that is not within everybody's power and is not easy.
angry.author: Aristotle

angry.text: The fire you kindle for your enemy often burns yourself more than them.
angry.author: Chinese Proverb

angry.text: Peace is not the absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
angry.author: Ronald Reagan

angry.text: Let us not look back in anger, nor forward in fear, but around in awareness.
angry.author: James Thurber

angry.text: Patience is the calm acceptance that things can happen in a different order than the one you have in mind.
angry.author: David G. Allen

angry.text: The strong person is not the one who doesn't feel anger, but the one who channels their anger into something constructive.
angry.author: Anonymous

angry.text: Take a deep breath. It calms the mind.
angry.author: Regina Brett

general.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
general.author: Steve Jobs

general.text: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
general.author: Robert Collier

general.text: Every moment is a fresh beginning.
general.author: T. S. Eliot

general.text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
general.author: Confucius

general.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
general.author: Theodore Roosevelt

general.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
general.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

general.text: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
general.author: Aristotle

general.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
general.author: Wayne Gretzky

general.text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
general.author: Thomas A. Edison

general.text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
general.author: Albert Einstein

general.text: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference.
general.author: Robert Frost

general.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
general.author: Buddha

general.text: The best revenge is massive success.
general.author: Frank Sinatra

general.text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
general.author: Theodore Roosevelt
